RaiseCommandEvent (FB)
RaiseCommandEvent (FB)
Â¶
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL RaiseCommandEvent
Raise an event related to a command of the given datapoint.
An instance of RaiseEvent allows to represent an instance of a datapoint of DNP3 object of groups
13 âbinary output command eventâ
42 âanalog output command eventâ
The DNP3 object group of the event to raise results from the DNP3 object group of the given point.
For example: an instance of BinaryOutput does relate to DNP3 object group 10 âbinary outputsâ,
and so using RaiseCommandEvent for such an instance of BinaryInput does raise an DNP3 object group 13 âbinary output command eventâ.
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Initial
Comment
Input
xExecute
BOOL
Raise event at rising edge (xExecute FALSE â> TRUE).
point
ICommandablePoint
The commandable point for which to raise the command event.
stat
USINT
0
The status from processing the command.
For an instance of BinaryOutput use DNPDEFS_CROB_ST_*.
For an instance of AnalogOutput use DNPDEFS_CTLSTAT_*.
Default is 0 which means either DNPDEFS_CROB_ST_SUCCESS or DNPDEFS_CTLSTAT_SUCCESS.
Output
xDone
BOOL
Event raised successfully.
xError
BOOL
Error during raise event.
eError
Error
Specific error during raise event.

rows.Name: xExecute
rows.Comment: Raise event at rising edge (xExecute FALSE â> TRUE).

rows: The commandable point for which to raise the command event.

The status from processing the command.
For an instance of BinaryOutput use DNPDEFS_CROB_ST_*.
For an instance of AnalogOutput use DNPDEFS_CTLSTAT_*.
Default is 0 which means either DNPDEFS_CROB_ST_SUCCESS or DNPDEFS_CTLSTAT_SUCCESS.
